original: Drangel, Gustaf Ernst Otto Alvar, kapten, godsägare. Herrestorps säteri, Vimmerby, f. 4/10/80 på Herrestorp, Pelarne, Kalmar 1., av godsäg. Otto D. o. Mathilda Lundquist. G. 1. 13 m. Lilly Österlind; 2. 40 m. Najan Carlsson. Barn: Boo Alvarsson f. 14, kapt. v. flygv. — Stud:ex. i Linköp. 99, AIHS 02-04. Und:löjtn. v. Norrl. art:reg. 01, löjtn. 04, kapt. 12. Chef f. Olof Glenne & Co. i Gbg 14-22, insp. i Nordstjernan 24-29, verk. inom silverrävsaveln 28-31, verkst. dir. i A-B Cubus i Sthlm 37-39, äg. o. beb. Herrestorps säteri m. Mossnästorp i Pelarne. Uppfinn, av patenterade spec :räknemask. Cubus A. o. Cubus B samt Prec:höjdmätaren. Skr.: 3 handböcker t. ovannämnda (37), Fick-tabeller f. kubering av ståndskog (44). RSO 25.
translated: Drangel, Gustaf Ernst Otto Alvar was a captain and estate owner of Herrestorps Manor in Vimmerby. He was born on October 4, 1880 at Herrestorp in Pelarne, Kalmar County. His parents were estate owner Otto D. and Mathilda Lundquist. Gustaf married twice, first to Lilly Österlind in 1913 and then to Najan Carlsson in 1940. He had one child, Boo Alvarsson who was born on the 14th day. Gustaf graduated from Linköping Secondary School in 1899 and from the Royal Swedish Army Artillery and Engineering College, AIHS, between 1902-1904. He was a second lieutenant in the Northern Artillery Regiment in 1901, became a lieutenant in 1904, and a captain in 1912. During his career, he served as the Manager of the Olof Glenne & Co. in Gothenburg from 1914 to 1922, inspector at Nordstjernan from 1924 to 1929, involved in silver fox breeding from 1928 to 1931, Managing Director of A-B Cubus in Stockholm from 1937 to 1939, and was owner and resident of Herrestorps Manor and Mossnästorp in Pelarne. He also invented patented devices such as the Cubus A and Cubus B numerical machines and the Precision Elevation Meter. He wrote three handbooks on the above-mentioned inventions in 1937 and Pocket Tables for the Cubing of Standing Forests in 1944. Gustaf received the Order of the Sword in 1925.
